title: Papers: PL giants ready to enter Rice war
shortDescription: All the top stories and transfer rumours from Wednesday's national newspapers...

title: Cole expected to join Lampard's Everton coaching staff on Wednesday
shortDescription: New Everton manager Frank Lampard is expected to add former Chelsea team-mate Ashley Cole to his coaching staff at Goodison Park on Wednesday.

title: Dundee slip to bottom spot after derby stalemate
shortDescription: Dundee were left bottom of the Premiership after being held to a goalless draw by Dundee United at the Kilmac Stadium.

title: Callachan earns point for Ross County
shortDescription: Ross County and Aberdeen cancelled each other out as they had to settle for a share of the spoils from a 1-1 cinch Premiership draw in Dingwall.

title: L1, L2 highlights, round-up: Rotherham hit five; Sheff Wed win
shortDescription: Rotherham thump Doncaster to assert their spot at the top of League One, while Sheffield Wednesday and Bolton also win. League Two leaders Forest Green hold Port Vale.

title: Tierney's last-gasp Motherwell leveller sparks fan clashes
shortDescription: Motherwell and St Mirren fans briefly clashed on the pitch after Ross Tierney scored a stoppage-time equaliser for the visitors in Paisley.

title: Edinburgh derby ends in stalemate
shortDescription: Hibernian and Hearts battled out another goalless draw in an incident-packed match at Easter Road.

title: PFA outlines reforms in pursuit of 'absolute parity' for female players
shortDescription: The PFA has warned there is much work to be done to achieve parity between female players and their male counterparts after outlining pioneering contract reforms.

title: White pen miss costs Preston at Millwall
shortDescription: Ben Whiteman missed a second-half penalty as Preston were forced to settle for a point in an otherwise tame goalless draw at Millwall.

title: Cornick fires Luton past Swansea
shortDescription: Harry Cornick came off the bench to score the only goal of the game against Swansea and lift Luton to within three points of the Sky Bet Championship play-off places.

title: Raith stand by Goodwillie signing despite angry backlash
shortDescription: Raith Rovers consider new signing David Goodwillie as 'part of the club' after the arrival of the striker sparked a backlash from club sponsor Val McDermid.

title: Auba: Leaving without a goodbye hurts | Arsenal confirm exit
shortDescription: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang says it "hurts" to leave Arsenal "without a real goodbye" after he left the club by mutual consent ahead of his move to Barcelona.

title: Road to Qatar 2022: South Korea book World Cup spot
shortDescription: It is crunch time on the road to Qatar 2022 but with the European slots nearly done and dusted, there are still several spaces left for nations across the globe...

title: Wednesday at AFCON: Senegal face Burkina Faso
shortDescription: Dates, kick-off times and host cities - here's the full schedule for AFCON 2021.

title: Greenwood further arrested on suspicion of sexual assault and threats to kill
shortDescription: Manchester United footballer Mason Greenwood has been further arrested on suspicion of sexual assault and threats to kill.

title: Sky Sports to show Papa John's Trophy semi-finals
shortDescription: Sky Sports have announced that the semi-finals of the Papa John's Trophy will be shown live in March.

title: EFL Live on Sky: 19 new Championship games announced
shortDescription: Here is how you can watch Championship matches live across Sky Sports throughout February and March.

title: Transfer talk pod: Deadline Day winners & losers
shortDescription: Pete and Dharms are joined by football writer Sam Tighe to discuss a frenetic Deadline Day

title: Ramsey: Why I joined Rangers on 'nervy' Deadline Day
shortDescription: Aaron Ramsey admits his Deadline Day move to Rangers was a "nervy experience", but the midfielder is now "excited" to reignite his career in Scotland.

title: Crawford nets winner as Saints end long winless streak
shortDescription: Ali Crawford netted a late winner for St Johnstone at 10-man Livingston as Callum Davidson's side picked up their first win in 13 games.
